name: Al/OSR Panel "Lapwing"
description: A large fixed array of aluminum honeycomb panels bonded with optical solar reflector (OSR) second-surface mirrors — the same approach used on early planetary spacecraft and the SNAP reactor test articles. The 4,900 m² panel spread is substantial but manufacturable from common materials, and the 800 K operating limit keeps thermal stress manageable. One array can reject the full waste-heat load of an early fission reactor.
